title: Stack overflow in rustdoc.

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
After making [this commit](https://github.com/aatxe/irc/commit/e1ab26a4bd3f409ba7366dafa4271aea8f539df5) to my IRC library, I noticed that `cargo doc` began to have a stack overflow. This also occurs when running `rustdoc src/lib.rs`. It happened locally on OS X and on Linux (only tested with Travis). 

```
White-Pillar:irc Aaron$ rustc --version
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (522d09dfe 2015-02-19) (built 2015-02-19)
White-Pillar:irc Aaron$ cargo --version
cargo 0.0.1-pre-nightly (43755c0 2015-02-19) (built 2015-02-19)
White-Pillar:irc Aaron$ rustdoc --version
rustdoc 1.0.0-nightly (522d09dfe 2015-02-19) (built 2015-02-19)
```

Here's a section of the stack trace from running `bt` in lldb (with rustdoc src/lib.rs). The full stack trace was roughly 600 frames, and involved a lot of repetition. I can produce more of it, if necessary or helpful.

```
* thread #2: tid = 0x2a83e0, 0x000000010418d885 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`rust_stack_exhausted + 37, stop reason = EXC_BAD_INSTRUCTION (code=EXC_I386_INVOP, subcode=0x0)
  * frame #0: 0x000000010418d885 libstd-4e7c5e5c.dylib`rust_stack_exhausted + 37
    frame #1: 0x0000000103a0ac4a libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`Parser$LT$$u27$a$GT$::new::hefdffc44efbc1bdaHxa
    frame #2: 0x000000010392663c libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::closure.58777 + 44
    frame #3: 0x00000001039265b2 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::he49ea36b35a6f26cwBd + 114
    frame #4: 0x00000001038d69d7 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::MacroExpander$LT$$u27$a$C$$u20$$u27$b$GT$.Folder::fold_expr::hbbfd54a27ece0c5czRe + 55
    frame #5: 0x000000010392f404 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`fold::noop_fold_expr::h5857166948994025101 + 6964
    frame #6: 0x0000000103926c01 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::closure.58777 + 1521
    frame #7: 0x00000001039265b2 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::he49ea36b35a6f26cwBd + 114
    frame #8: 0x00000001038d69d7 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::MacroExpander$LT$$u27$a$C$$u20$$u27$b$GT$.Folder::fold_expr::hbbfd54a27ece0c5czRe + 55
    frame #9: 0x0000000103932304 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`fold::noop_fold_expr::closure.58828 + 52
    frame #10: 0x000000010392df3e libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`fold::noop_fold_expr::h5857166948994025101 + 1646
    frame #11: 0x0000000103926c01 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::closure.58777 + 1521
    frame #12: 0x00000001039265b2 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::he49ea36b35a6f26cwBd + 114
    frame #13: 0x00000001038d69d7 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::MacroExpander$LT$$u27$a$C$$u20$$u27$b$GT$.Folder::fold_expr::hbbfd54a27ece0c5czRe + 55
    frame #14: 0x0000000103932304 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`fold::noop_fold_expr::closure.58828 + 52
    frame #15: 0x000000010392dd0e libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`fold::noop_fold_expr::h5857166948994025101 + 1086
    frame #16: 0x0000000103926c01 libsyntax-4e7c5e5c.dylib`ext::expand::expand_expr::closure.58777 + 1521
```

To add some more detail, everything is fine when I run `cargo build` and `cargo test`.
